title: A Year in the Life [5/12]
body:
Title: A Year in the Life

Summary: Everyone writes off 2012 as the year of ‘No Homo Howell’, implying that Dan’s demeanor was linked to stress over his sexuality and relationship with Phil. But that’s only the tip of the iceberg - with an unsteady future, undiagnosed mental illness, and suddenly thrust into the public eye, 2012 was a tumultuous year, one that no one has yet to truly understand.

Chapter: 5 - May

Word Count: 2.1k (11.5k total)

Relationship: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

Rating: E

Chapter Warnings: mentions of smut

Read on AO3 | January | February | March | April 

5/5/12 – 10:07 PM

Phil decided he quite liked doing live shows. Being able to engage with his audience in real time allowed him to immerse himself into his YouTube persona and practice letting it flow more naturally. Or, in other words, he could cover his and Dan’s asses the way the other had been urging him to. And so began the lie of ‘we met through a mutual friend’.

“I’m just saying it’s still something they could fact check,” Phil remarked over dinner.

“Maybe so, but who’s gonna be that concerned with it?” Dan shrugged between bites. “I do appreciate you helping the cause, so to speak.”

“If it calms your paranoid ass, it’s a risk I’m willing to take,” he chuckled, shaking his head before the buzzing of his phone stole his attention away.

Dan rolled his eyes. “Does she ever text you during daylight hours? Asking for a friend. Your friend. Me.”

Phil bristled at his remark, holding his phone out of Dan’s line of vision protectively. “She works during the day, Dan. Not everyone operates on a YouTube schedule,” he huffed, “I see her in the day sometimes too.”

“I’m just worried she’s only using you for your hot bod,” he teased.

“Shut up!” he laughed, throwing a napkin at him.

5/16/12 – 1:18 PM

Dan was straining slightly as he hauled several full shopping bags into the apartment. “They were out of the biscuits that you like, so I—” he stopped short, startled, and nearly dropped his grocery haul. “Jesus Christ, Phil!”

Phil had made an offhand remark about Charlotte coming over that afternoon, and Dan hadn’t thought twice about it. What he did not anticipate, however, was to walk in on the pair mid-fellatio. While Charlotte still had her panties on, Phil was completely naked and sprawled out shamelessly on the sofa. She shot up, startled and covered her breasts with her arm, but he seemed to have a bit of a delayed reaction, though he did offer an emphatic “I’m sorry! We just…got caught up!”

“Oh, you just got ‘caught up’ did you?” Dan rolled his eyes, unceremoniously dropping the bags on the breakfast bar. “You knew I wasn’t going to be gone for long!”

“What, you think I was hoping you’d catch me like some weird voyeur?” it was at that point they both noticed that Dan hadn’t taken his eyes off them since he’d spotted them, cheeks turning red and gaze quickly shifting to the floor.

Charlotte noticed it as well, but might have interpreted it differently. “You can join us if you want, Dan.”

This completely caught Dan off guard, standing in stunned silence for a solid couple moments. “I-I uh…am going to have to pass, thank you,” he finally got out, shaking his head. “But that’s a, uh, nice setup you’ve got there,” he said in reference to her body, then visibly cringed at how awful that must have sounded, and promptly left to his room.

“Why did you say that to him?” Phil asked when they were alone, having been nearly as shocked as the other male at her offer.

“It’d have been hot,” she shrugged. “Besides, I’ve gotten the vibe that you’re kind of into him. It’s okay, my ex-boyfriend was bi too.”

It hadn’t occurred to Phil that his feelings for Dan had been obvious enough for someone else to pick up on, especially someone he was dating. He started to think the focus on distancing themselves online might not be a bad idea – the fans studied their interactions more than anyone else. If nothing else, it was in their best interests to keep up the ‘mutual friend’ story as their meeting origin. “Next time, I’d rather you run that sort of thing by me, yeah?”

Charlotte nodded. “I’m sorry if I put you in an awkward position,” she told him, and as far as he could tell, she meant it.

“Do you…want to pick back up?”

“Dunno if the mood’s still there, babe,” she chuckled, gesturing to Phil’s now flaccid cock.

So, they spent the rest of the afternoon watching movies. Charlotte left around seven to work the night shift at Starbucks, leaving Dan and Phil in the wake of the earlier exchange. Phil decided it would be worse to ignore it than to clear the air and face whatever awkward confrontation followed. “Dan? Can we talk for a minute?”

“Is your cock still out?”

Phil rolled his eyes and let himself into Dan’s room. “Not unless you want it to be,” he retorted, sitting down on the bed and waiting for him to turn to face him. “If it makes you feel any better, I couldn’t get it back up after you left.”

“That does make me feel a bit better, yes,” Dan said, spinning away from his computer screen. “Are you still going to try to get me to believe that you ‘forgot’ that I only went to Tesco’s?”

There were a few minutes of silence as Phil tried to figure out how to explain his actions. He did know that there was a high probability of being caught from the moment things started to get hot and heavy, but he wasn’t sure what compelled him to follow through. Was he jealous? Angry? Spiteful? Maybe he was just that horny. “I didn’t forget,” he finally confessed, “but I don’t know why I did it, and I apologize.”

Dan’s expression was somewhere between disbelief and amusement. “You’re so fucking weird, Phil,” he shook his head. “If this is a new kink for you, at least give me a bit of a warning next time.”

“You’re not mad?”

“I don’t think I’ve gotten over the shock yet, quite frankly. I’m hoping I’ll just be able to repress it and it’ll go away.”

Phil chuckled, patting Dan on the shoulder as he got up to leave. “Whatever works.”

5/22/12 – 9:32 AM

“I’m beginning to think this is somewhat of a coping mechanism for you,” PJ remarked as Dan climbed into the passenger seat of his car.

“I’m beginning to think you need to mind your business,” Dan retorted with a dry laugh. It was the fourth time in the past week or so that PJ picked him up from a one-night-stand’s place to drop him off back at his flat. They had even started making detours for breakfast, making a morning out of saving him from a walk of shame.

They walked into the diner and sat in the booth, Dan turning to check his phone. There was no shortage of messages – ones from OkCupid, texts from past and potentially future partners, but none from Phil – and Dan seemed bothered by that. “I could be dead, you know. You’d think he would check in.”

“He knows you’re with me,” PJ reminded him. “So, there’s only like, a forty percent chance you could be dead.”

The waitress came to them a few moments later, and throughout their meal, her attempts at flirtation were far from subtle, but Dan hardly acknowledged it, let alone reciprocated. This caused PJ to look at him in surprise, but waited until they were alone again before he voiced his feelings. “She’s absolutely gorgeous, Dan. Are you sick or something?”

Dan shrugged, picking at the food he had barely touched. “I’m too tired, Peej. I think I’ve actually managed to reach my threshold on the amount of casual sex I can have. It’s not making me feel any better.”

“What exactly are you hoping to feel?”

He pursed his lips, strumming his fingers against the table. “Guess I’m trying not to feel anything. As long as I’ve got a warm body next to me, I don’t have to be alone with my thoughts.”

“I’m starting to worry about you, Dan,” he frowned as they took care of the bill.

Dan rolled his eyes, getting up and shoving his hands into the pockets of his jeans. “Get in line.”

5/27/12 – 3:12 PM

Yesterday had been a positive one for Dan and Phil. They had spent time with a friend and her baby, and it left them both in a good mood, a welcome change in energy. “I’m feeling quite broody now honestly,” Dan admitted. They were sat in the lounge – Dan in his chair and Phil on the couch, both with their laptops out. “Tell me that wasn’t one of the cutest babies you’ve ever seen.”

Phil smiled fondly. “She’s adorable. I can’t wait to have kids…maybe when I’m confident that I won’t drop it,” he mused with a laugh.

“I’d like to see you keep a fish alive before you even try to fathom having a child. Hell, keep a plant going for a while and I’ll be impressed.”

“You have no faith in me,” Phil huffed. He looked up from his laptop and watched Dan for a moment, suddenly feeling a pang of sadness. Not too long ago, he was certain that their future held that – marriage, kids, a house in the suburbs with a yard big enough for a dog to run around in. But everything felt uncertain now. As much as he kept reminding himself that their break was temporary, he feared things would never be the same when they picked back up, that they would never be able to love each other as much as they did when they first fell.

“You alright?”

“Huh?” he must have gotten lost in thought, realizing he was now looking Dan right in the eyes, and could see the concern in his expression. “Yeah, I’m good. Just…sad that I may never be coordinated enough to care for a child full time,” he forced a laugh with that.

Dan hesitated to believe Phil, even if he wanted to. He immediately felt guilty, despite not having a reason to, for once. “I don’t like that face. It was too sad. Don’t do it again,” he mumbled.

A small but sincere smile settled on Phil’s lips. “I’ll do my best,” he promised.

5/31/12 – 6:54 PM

“Are you sure you want to stay here? I think I’ll be okay on my own for a few hours,” Dan was laying in bed, tucked in tightly and sounding weak despite his best efforts to hide it.

Phil nodded, sitting beside Dan and gently running his fingers through his hair. He and Charlotte had originally planned to see The Chernobyl Diaries on her day off, but when Dan’s complaints of stomach pain developed into a full-blown virus, Phil dropped his plans to tend to him. “I’m sure she’ll understand.”

Dan started to sit up, but Phil immediately made him lay back down. “I don’t want to fuck up your night over a tummy ache.”

“Hey, shut up,” he said with gentle affection. “I’m going to stay and help you feel better and that’s the end of it. Now stay put while I go make you some tea.”

After Phil left, Dan noticed his phone had fallen out of his pocket and on to the bed. Unable to help himself, he glanced at the home screen and saw the most recent text from Charlotte. It read ‘I hope you don’t have to take him to A&E, this is the third time he’s gotten sick on your watch’. He furrowed his brows – this had been the only time he had fallen ill this year.

“Oh, that’s where I left it,” he remarked when he returned to Dan’s room, setting the mug down on the end table.

“Why does Charlotte think I’ve gotten sick three times?” he would deal with the repercussions of peeping on his phone later, he was more concerned with getting answers.

Phil furrowed his brows and picked up his phone, reading the same message. He chewed on his lip as he slid his phone into his pocket. “There may have been a couple incidents where I wanted to stay home after having already made plans, so I said I needed to look after you. Maybe I jinxed you so, uh, sorry about that.”

“Why didn’t you just say you’re sick?”

“Cause then she might’ve come over here instead.”

Dan sat up to take a sip of tea, looking at Phil with a bemused grin. “Phil, you can’t keep hiding from your girlfriend.”

Phil looked unsettled at the label and felt his stomach tighten. “It’s not that serious, it’ll be fine,” he assured, shifting to sit more comfortably on the bed and set the mug down when Dan was done. To his surprise, he cuddled up to him and rest his head on his chest.

“Thank you for being so good to me. I don’t deserve it at all.”

He wrapped his arms around the younger male. “Maybe not, but that’s never stopped me before.”

tags: and we need to accept that
or maybe his technician and/or dentist is really hot
summary: He might have had to go back for work found during his original appointment. I’ve had to go back for fillings and wisdom teeth...
question: He might have had to go back for work found during his original appointment. I’ve had to go back for fillings and wisdom teeth removal before for example. Sometimes as they didn’t have time to do the work and sometimes because I wanted to put it off. 😂 Also if I suddenly get problems or think I’m getting an infection. Going more than twice a year otherwise isn’t standard so that’d be my guess.
answer: He says he goes to see a technician every three months, which is the person who cleans your teeth, not removes anything or does fillings.

blog.name: phanfictioncatalogue
blog.title: phanfiction catalogue
blog.description:
mobile users, click here!

please refer to our FAQ first.

Our goal is to create an alphabetized library of every phanfiction in the phandom. Besides that, we compile masterlists of different genres that are scheduled for posting every few days, and help find fics that have been mislocated.

title: Happy Ending (3) Masterlist
body:
part one, part two

A Game for Those Who Seek to Find a Way to Leave Their World Behind - jilliancares

Summary: In which Dan finds a strange board game and ends up playing it (and releasing its horrors) with his best friend Carrie and arch enemy, Phil.

A Somber Day - cawerkuu

Summary: Dan has been a bit off lately and won’t tell Phil why. Despite not being a pushy Phil, he can’t take it and tries to find out for himself.

A Tale of Time and Torture - jewelphan

Summary: Phil had always had a rather dull and boring life, but that all changes when he ends up getting taken by complete strangers in the middle of the night. He ends up getting tortured and experimented on in a place far away from home, but it all becomes worth it in the end.

Bury Your Flame - botanistlester

Summary: (tw) After receiving a dragon egg when his grandfather passed away, Phil is forced to ask for help from the local dragon tamer. As he soon finds out, Dan Howell is nothing he’s been expecting. Infuriating, ludicrous, and completely lacking respect, Dan is everything Phil hates. But Phil will do anything to make his grandfather proud, even if that means getting help from the local cluck.

Collision (ao3) - TortiTabby

Summary: A day full of arguing and disagreements on tour gets turned on it’s head when an incident puts things in perspective.

Don’t it Feel Good? - obsessive-fics

Summary: the FWB fic with none of the smut, all of the angst, and a ridiculously happy ending.

Give Me Something To Hold Onto - phantasticlizzy

Summary: Dan and Phil need to learn how to be together again, but can they do it when everything feels so broken?

Happy Mistakes (ao3) - mollieblack

Summary: Dan’s mother is terminally ill and all she wants is for her son to finally find someone to settle down with, so when there’s a misunderstanding and she thinks he and Phil are dating, Phil panics and goes along with it, if only to keep her happy in her last days.

Neither of them planned on her getting better

How to Be Amazing (ao3) - phanburnhamizzard

Summary: Phil Lester is strong. He is amazing. But after months on tour battling car sickness, stage fright, and fatigue, it is all becoming too much. One night, in the middle of Interactive Introverts, Phil pushes himself to the brink.

If the Crown Fits - nerdydisneychild

Summary: The Royalty AU nobody asked for in which Prince Daniel falls head over heels for his best friend and servant boy, Phil.

In the mess of it all (ao3) - tigreluna

Summary: Dan and Phil mid-way trough their second and last tour. Everything seemed to be going fine: their audience were enjoying themselves and so did Dan and Phil. But on one show, something happened, Phil dind’t know if he could keep doing it.

I Won’t Fall (Unless You Ask Me To) (ao3) - legdabs (scvlly)

Summary: In 2009, it feels like nothing can last forever. but it could.

Like A Fire (ao3) - watergator

Summary: Phil is having a bad day on tour and he takes it out on Dan.

Looking Back - itislacey

Summary: Dan and Phil, old and gray and in their eighties, still make the most out of life, despite some difficult changes. Told through their present day and very domestic flashbacks, Dan and Phil will be together forever. Phil promised.

Losing Grip (on Sinking Ships) - phloridas

Summary: When tensions flare up and everything seems to fall to pieces around Dan and Phil, a few choice words may be all Phil needs to cut the string entirely. But can a couple songs convince him to stay, even for just a moment?

Mottled Roses - auroraphilealis

Summary: Dan lives in a world where, when someone starts losing friendship, interest, or love for you, a rose magically appears on your bedside table, and you have one last chance to try and fix things before the last petal falls. His best friend Phil promised that Dan would never receive a rose from Phil, but one morning… Dan does.

Soundless - itislacey

Summary: Phil Lester moves to town and attends a school full of cliques. He doesn’t see his life going anywhere until he somehow manages to befriend the mute kid in school. Now he’s beginning to learn that life can take you anywhere, and is full of friends in unlikely places. But in the wake of a tragedy, Phil must learn to understand not just words, but actions. Because sometimes, the loudest cry for help can be soundless.

Timid Heart, Hide My Scars (Make Me Stronger) - pasteldanhowells

Summary: Dan has trust issues thanks to his abusive ex-boyfriend. Then, he meets Phil by randomly bumping into him one day. Dan’s worried about Phil finding out about his past. Phil shows Dan that not every man is like Matthew.

when there’s no storm (ao3) - iihappydaysii

Summary: dan and phil go to couple’s counseling.

Wonders Never Cease - lilacskylester

Summary: Dan and Phil were one of the ‘it’ couples at their high school until one day, Phil blindsides Dan with a break up. Hurting and seeking comfort, Dan befriends Tyler who helps him get through the first tough few months of the break up, mending his shattered heart. But Dan doesn’t want to move on. He wants to be with Phil and maybe, just maybe, in the end, he’ll still get to be.

Because sometimes, the loudest cry for help can be soundless.

Timid Heart, Hide My Scars (Make Me Stronger) - pasteldanhowells

Summary: Dan has trust issues thanks to his abusive ex-boyfriend. Then, he meets Phil by randomly bumping into him one day. Dan’s worried about Phil finding out about his past. Phil shows Dan that not every man is like Matthew.

when there’s no storm (ao3) - iihappydaysii

Summary: dan and phil go to couple’s counseling.

Wonders Never Cease - lilacskylester

Summary: Dan and Phil were one of the ‘it’ couples at their high school until one day, Phil blindsides Dan with a break up. Hurting and seeking comfort, Dan befriends Tyler who helps him get through the first tough few months of the break up, mending his shattered heart. But Dan doesn’t want to move on. He wants to be with Phil and maybe, just maybe, in the end, he’ll still get to be.

trail.content_raw:
part one, part two

A Game for Those Who Seek to Find a Way to Leave Their World Behind - jilliancares

Summary: In which Dan finds a strange board game and ends up playing it (and releasing its horrors) with his best friend Carrie and arch enemy, Phil.

A Somber Day - cawerkuu

Summary: Dan has been a bit off lately and won’t tell Phil why. Despite not being a pushy Phil, he can’t take it and tries to find out for himself.

A Tale of Time and Torture - jewelphan

Summary: Phil had always had a rather dull and boring life, but that all changes when he ends up getting taken by complete strangers in the middle of the night. He ends up getting tortured and experimented on in a place far away from home, but it all becomes worth it in the end.

Bury Your Flame - botanistlester

Summary: (tw) After receiving a dragon egg when his grandfather passed away, Phil is forced to ask for help from the local dragon tamer. As he soon finds out, Dan Howell is nothing he’s been expecting. Infuriating, ludicrous, and completely lacking respect, Dan is everything Phil hates. But Phil will do anything to make his grandfather proud, even if that means getting help from the local cluck.

Collision (ao3) - TortiTabby

Summary: A day full of arguing and disagreements on tour gets turned on it’s head when an incident puts things in perspective.

Don’t it Feel Good? - obsessive-fics

Summary: the FWB fic with none of the smut, all of the angst, and a ridiculously happy ending.

Give Me Something To Hold Onto - phantasticlizzy

Summary: Dan and Phil need to learn how to be together again, but can they do it when everything feels so broken?

Happy Mistakes (ao3) - mollieblack

Summary: Dan’s mother is terminally ill and all she wants is for her son to finally find someone to settle down with, so when there’s a misunderstanding and she thinks he and Phil are dating, Phil panics and goes along with it, if only to keep her happy in her last days.

Neither of them planned on her getting better

How to Be Amazing (ao3) - phanburnhamizzard

Summary: Phil Lester is strong. He is amazing. But after months on tour battling car sickness, stage fright, and fatigue, it is all becoming too much. One night, in the middle of Interactive Introverts, Phil pushes himself to the brink.

If the Crown Fits - nerdydisneychild

Summary: The Royalty AU nobody asked for in which Prince Daniel falls head over heels for his best friend and servant boy, Phil.

In the mess of it all (ao3) - tigreluna

Summary: Dan and Phil mid-way trough their second and last tour. Everything seemed to be going fine: their audience were enjoying themselves and so did Dan and Phil. But on one show, something happened, Phil dind’t know if he could keep doing it.

I Won’t Fall (Unless You Ask Me To) (ao3) - legdabs (scvlly)

Summary: In 2009, it feels like nothing can last forever. but it could.

Like A Fire (ao3) - watergator

Summary: Phil is having a bad day on tour and he takes it out on Dan.

Looking Back - itislacey

Summary: Dan and Phil, old and gray and in their eighties, still make the most out of life, despite some difficult changes. Told through their present day and very domestic flashbacks, Dan and Phil will be together forever. Phil promised.

Losing Grip (on Sinking Ships) - phloridas

Summary: When tensions flare up and everything seems to fall to pieces around Dan and Phil, a few choice words may be all Phil needs to cut the string entirely. But can a couple songs convince him to stay, even for just a moment?

Mottled Roses - auroraphilealis

Summary: Dan lives in a world where, when someone starts losing friendship, interest, or love for you, a rose magically appears on your bedside table, and you have one last chance to try and fix things before the last petal falls. His best friend Phil promised that Dan would never receive a rose from Phil, but one morning… Dan does.
